channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ultra-rich Americans ditching stocks and real estate, says investing legend — 5 assets they’re using to shockproof
Fisherman shares video after catching massive fish wreaking havoc on US waterways: 'Like fighting a car'
Drones target German ports, hospitals and oil refineries in latest hybrid attack
Mortgage and refinance interest rates today, October 1, 2025: A small move down as rates work to find a direction
Rescuers hunt for survivors after Philippines' deadliest quake in over a decade kills at least 69
What is a government shutdown? Here's what happens when funding runs out
item.description: Much of the federal government shut down after Congress failed to reach a deal to approve new funding. Here's what that means.

item.title: Does Congress get paid during a government shutdown?
item.description: The shutdown raises questions about what it would mean for lawmakers themselves — and their paychecks.

item.title: Accusations fly over whether Republicans or Democrats 'own' shutdown
item.description: The closure came amid an impasse between congressional Democrats and Republicans, who are being led by President Donald Trump.

item.title: WATCH: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly 7 years
item.description: The federal government is officially shut down. ABC News' Jay O'Brien explains how we got here.

item.title: Offshore earthquake kills at least 69 in Philippines, officials say
item.description: A powerful 6.9-magnitude earthquake killed at least 69 people in the Philippines, officials said on Wednesday.

item.title: Democrats embrace a shutdown fight in a rare moment of unity against Trump
How could a government shutdown affect travel around the U.S.?
item.description: A prolonged government shutdown, as occurred in 2018, could lead to long lines at TSA checkpoints and economic losses, experts warn.

item.title: Government shutdown begins as the nation faces a new period of uncertainty
item.description: Vice President JD Vance says Republicans want to resolve the health care issues that concern Democrats and led to the government shutdown but won’t ne...

item.title: Government website blames shutdown on "radical left," prompts ethics complaint
item.description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development posted a banner on its homepage Tuesday blaming the government shutdown on the "Radical Left."

item.title: Mike Johnson, Hakeem Jeffries speak on Trump's 'war from within' comments
item.description: A day after Trump said the U.S. is fighting a "war from within," Speaker Mike Johnson and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries react to the president...

item.title: Why is the government shut down? Here's what's behind the funding lapse
item.description: The government shut down Wednesday after lawmakers failed to reach an agreement to extend government funding.

item.title: WATCH: Carnival ride malfunctions at California school event
item.description: Riders were reportedly trapped for up to an hour after a carnival ride malfunction at a school event in Southern California. No injuries were reported...

item.title: What happens now that a government shutdown is underway
